channel.title: Comments on: Yet another day wasted on IE

item.title: By: Richard Moy
item.dc:creator: Richard Moy
item.description: <p>Matt,</p><p>I thought I saw a blog about this problem I believe about a year or two ago. However, I can't remember how the other person resolved it or whether he did.</p>
item.content:encoded:
Matt,

I thought I saw a blog about this problem I believe about a year or two ago. However, I can't remember how the other person resolved it or whether he did.

item.title: By: Fredrik Norling
item.dc:creator: Fredrik Norling
item.description: <p>I got a IE problem my self this week with javascript calculation problems so I know the feeling ;-)<br/><a href="http://www.xpagedeveloper.com/2011/strange-javascript-numbers-ie9" title="strange js errors is IE9" rel="nofollow ugc"></a></p>
item.content:encoded: I got a IE problem my self this week with javascript calculation problems so I know the feeling ðŸ˜‰

item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>@Paul - Yes compatibility mode was the first thing I tried as it can be used to cover a multitude of sins, but in this case it offered no help at all.</p>
item.content:encoded: @Paul – Yes compatibility mode was the first thing I tried as it can be used to cover a multitude of sins, but in this case it offered no help at all.

item.title: By: Frederic Dehedin
item.dc:creator: Frederic Dehedin
item.description: <p>thanks for the share.<br/>Absolutely agree with you, i always got no problems with FF, Chrome, Safari, and Opera, since they behave very similar.. The one who dances out of the row is always IE.. <br/>Got less problems in XPages webapps tough, but the generated html sourcecode of XPages is still kinda "stability over beauty" like, which is absolutely fine for webapps.. </p><p>regards,</p>
item.content:encoded:
thanks for the share.
Absolutely agree with you, i always got no problems with FF, Chrome, Safari, and Opera, since they behave very similar.. The one who dances out of the row is always IE..
Got less problems in XPages webapps tough, but the generated html sourcecode of XPages is still kinda "stability over beauty" like, which is absolutely fine for webapps..

regards,

item.title: By: Paul Withers
item.dc:creator: Paul Withers
item.description: <p>Just a hunch. Was it happening with IE 8 both in compatibility mode and not? I know to my cost that IE 8 compatibility mode ignores float, as a result of which I had to force IE 8 to ignore compatibllity mode for one of my apps, to ensure it looked like it was designed to.</p>
item.content:encoded: Just a hunch. Was it happening with IE 8 both in compatibility mode and not? I know to my cost that IE 8 compatibility mode ignores float, as a result of which I had to force IE 8 to ignore compatibllity mode for one of my apps, to ensure it looked like it was designed to.
